workflow.name: Smartlead to HubSpot Performance Analytics
workflow.description:
*Smartlead to HubSpot Performance Analytics
A streamlined workflow to analyze your Smartlead performance metrics by tracking lifecycle stages in HubSpot and generating automated reports.*

## **Who is this for?**

(Outbound) Automation Agencies, Sales and marketing teams using Smartlead for outreach campaigns who want to track their performance metrics and lead progression in HubSpot.

**What problem does this workflow solve?**

Manual tracking of lead performance across Smartlead and HubSpot is time-consuming and error-prone. This workflow automates performance reporting by connecting your Smartlead data with HubSpot lifecycle stages, providing clear insights into your outreach campaign effectiveness.

**What this workflow does**

Automatically pulls performance data from your Smartlead campaigns
Cross-references contact status with HubSpot lifecycle stages
Generates comprehensive performance reports in Google Sheets
Provides customizable reporting schedules to match your team's needs

## **Setup Requirements**

### **PostgreSQL Database**

Set up your PostgreSQL instance (includes $300 free GCP credits)
Follow our step-by-step setup guide: [Find a step-by-step guide here](https://github.com/wukimidaire/postgres_table_templates)


### **Google Account Integration**

Connect your Google Account to n8n
[Find the guide here](https://docs.n8n.io/integrations/builtin/credentials/google/#compatible-nodes)


### **Smartlead Configuration**

Connect your Smartlead instance:
Detailed connection guide included in workflow



### **How to customize this workflow**

Configure the Trigger node to adjust report frequency
Modify the Google Sheets template to match your specific KPIs
Customize HubSpot lifecycle stage mapping in the Function node
Adjust PostgreSQL queries to track additional metrics

Need assistance or have suggestions? 
lmk [**here**](https://www.linkedin.com/in/victordecoster/)

nodes.name: Code

parameters.query:
SELECT
    ca.id,
    ca.campaign_id,
    ca.email,
    MIN(ca.first_name) AS first_name,
    MIN(ca.last_name) AS last_name,
    SUM(ca.reply_count) AS reply_count,
    max(hb_lifecyclestage_check_timestamp) as hb_lifecyclestage_check_timestamp,
    CASE
        -- Check if there is a comma and handle the extraction first
        WHEN MIN(ca.linkedin_profile) LIKE '%,%' 
            THEN 
                -- Replace /sales/people/ with /in/ on the extracted part before the comma
                REPLACE(LEFT(MIN(ca.linkedin_profile), POSITION(',' IN MIN(ca.linkedin_profile)) - 1), '/sales/people/', '/in/')
        ELSE 
            -- For profiles without a comma, check for the replacement directly
            REPLACE(MIN(ca.linkedin_profile), '/sales/people/', '/in/')
    END AS linkedin_profile,
    MAX(ca.company_url) AS company_profile,
    -- Extracting domain from email to create the website column
    SUBSTRING(ca.email FROM POSITION('@' IN ca.email) + 1) AS website,
    c.created_at,
    c.updated_at,
    c.status,
    c.name
FROM
    outbound_activities.ce_campaign_activity ca
JOIN
    outbound_activities.ce_campaign c ON ca.campaign_id = c.campaign_id
--left join outbound_activities.hubspot hb on 

WHERE 
  hb_lifecyclestage_check_timestamp IS NULL 
  OR hb_lifecyclestage_check_timestamp < NOW() - INTERVAL '24 hours'

  
GROUP BY
    ca.id,
    ca.campaign_id,
    ca.email,
    c.created_at,
    c.updated_at,
    c.status,
    c.name


limit 5000

parameters.content: ## Search for your smartlead API key [here](https://app.smartlead.ai/app/settings/profile)

parameters.query:
SELECT 
    h.campaign_id,
        c.status,
    c.name,
    COUNT(DISTINCT h.hubspot_company_id) AS total_companies,
    SUM(CASE WHEN h.lifecyclestage = 'lead' AND h.hs_num_open_deals != 0 THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) AS lead_count,
    SUM(CASE WHEN h.lifecyclestage = 'marketingqualifiedlead' AND h.hs_num_open_deals != 0 THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) AS marketingqualifiedlead_count,
    SUM(CASE WHEN h.lifecyclestage = 'salesqualifiedlead' AND h.hs_num_open_deals != 0 THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) AS salesqualifiedlead_count,
    SUM(CASE WHEN h.lifecyclestage = 'opportunity' AND h.hs_num_open_deals != 0 THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) AS opportunity_count,
    SUM(CASE WHEN h.lifecyclestage = 'customer' AND h.hs_num_open_deals != 0 THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) AS customer_count,
    SUM(CASE WHEN h.lifecyclestage = '140669943' AND h.hs_num_open_deals != 0 THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) AS lifecyclestage_140669943_count,
    SUM(CASE WHEN h.lifecyclestage = '140669942' AND h.hs_num_open_deals != 0 THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) AS lifecyclestage_140669942_count
FROM 
    outbound_activities.hubspot h
JOIN 
    outbound_activities.ce_campaign c ON h.campaign_id = c.campaign_id
GROUP BY 
    h.campaign_id, c.status, c.name

parameters.content:
## POSTGRES INSTALATION [Guide](https://github.com/wukimidaire/postgres_table_templates)

## Follow this step by step guide, focus on the next 3 table creations for this flow:
## - ce_campaign_activity
## - ce_campaign
## - hubspot

## Campaign Analytics Report Documentation

Overview

This report provides a high-level summary of campaign performance, designed to help stakeholders quickly assess the outcomes of marketing or sales campaigns. It includes data on campaign activity, targeted audiences, and progression metrics, allowing for a holistic view of campaign effectiveness.

## Key Metrics

	1	**Campaign Identification and Status**

        •	Campaign ID: A unique identifier assigned to each campaign for tracking purposes.
	•	Status: Indicates the current state of the campaign:
	•	Active: Campaign is ongoing.
	•	Paused: Campaign is temporarily on hold.
	•	Archived: Campaign has concluded.

2       **Targeting and Reach**

	•	Total Companies: Number of companies targeted within the campaign scope.


3	**Pipeline Metrics**

	•	Lead Count: Total number of leads generated by the campaign.
	•	Marketing Qualified Leads (MQLs): Leads that meet predefined marketing qualification criteria.
	•	Sales Qualified Leads (SQLs): Leads that are validated as sales-ready by the team.
	•	Opportunities: Potential deals created from campaign engagement.
	•	Customers: Number of deals successfully closed, converting leads into customers.


4	**Lifecycle Stages**

	•	Lifecycle Stage Metrics: Counts of entities (e.g., leads, opportunities, or customers) at specific lifecycle stages. These stages represent the journey from lead generation to conversion.



## How to Use This Report

	•	**Evaluate Campaign Success**: Compare metrics like total companies, leads, and customers to understand campaign impact.
	•	**Understand Pipeline Health**: Analyze how many entities progress through the funnel (e.g., from MQL to SQL to Opportunity).
	•	**Monitor Campaign Status**: Use the status column to focus on active campaigns or review the outcomes of archived ones.
	•	**Assess Engagement**: Check opportunity and customer counts to gauge how effective the campaign is in driving conversions.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
